Manages a Bastion Host.

> **Note:** Bastion Hosts are a preview feature in Azure, and therefore are only supported in a select number of regions. [Read more](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/bastion/bastion-faq).

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="DataDiskAttachment" data-link-title="DataDiskAttachment">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/dataDiskAttachment.ts#L19">
        Resource <strong>DataDiskAttachment</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>DataDiskAttachment</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages attaching a Disk to a Virtual Machine.

> **NOTE:** Data Disks can be attached either directly on the `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource, or using the `azure.compute.DataDiskAttachment` resource - but the two cannot be used together. If both are used against the same Virtual Machine, spurious changes will occur.

> **Please Note:** only Managed Disks are supported via this separate resource, Unmanaged Disks can be attached using the `storageDataDisk` block in the `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource.


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/virtual_machine_data_disk_attachment.html.markdown.

* `name` The _unique_ name of the resource.
* `args` The arguments to use to populate this resource&#39;s properties.
* `opts` A bag of options that control this resource&#39;s behavior.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="DiskEncryptionSet" data-link-title="DiskEncryptionSet">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/diskEncryptionSet.ts#L19">
        Resource <strong>DiskEncryptionSet</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>DiskEncryptionSet</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a Disk Encryption Set.

> **NOTE**: Disk Encryption Sets are in Public Preview and at this time is only available in `Canada Central`, `North Europe` and `West Central US` regions - [more information can be found in the preview documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/linux/disk-encryption).

> **NOTE:** At this time the Key Vault used to store the Active Key for this Disk Encryption Set must have both Soft Delete & Purge Protection enabled - which are not yet supported by this provider.


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/disk_encryption_set.html.markdown.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="Extension" data-link-title="Extension">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/extension.ts#L20">
        Resource <strong>Extension</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>Extension</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a Virtual Machine Extension to provide post deployment configuration
and run automated tasks.

> **NOTE:** Custom Script Extensions for Linux & Windows require that the `commandToExecute` returns a `0` exit code to be classified as successfully deployed. You can achieve this by appending `exit 0` to the end of your `commandToExecute`.

> **NOTE:** Custom Script Extensions require that the Azure Virtual Machine Guest Agent is running on the Virtual Machine.


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/virtual_machine_extension.html.markdown.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="Extension-constructor">

Create a Extension resource with the given unique name, arguments, and options.

* `name` The _unique_ name of the resource.
* `args` The arguments to use to populate this resource&#39;s properties.
* `opts` A bag of options that control this resource&#39;s behavior.

urn is the stable logical URN used to distinctly address a resource, both before and after

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachine" data-link-title="LinuxVirtualMachine">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachine.ts#L25">
        Resource <strong>LinuxVirtualMachine</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>LinuxVirtualMachine</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a Linux Virtual Machine.

#### Disclaimers

> **Note** This provider will automatically remove the OS Disk by default - this behaviour can be configured using the `features` configuration within the Provider configuration block.

> **Note** This resource does not support Unmanaged Disks. If you need to use Unmanaged Disks you can continue to use the `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource instead.

> **Note** This resource does not support attaching existing OS Disks. You can instead capture an image of the OS Disk or continue to use the `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource instead.

> In this release there's a known issue where the `publicIpAddress` and `publicIpAddresses` fields may not be fully populated for Dynamic Public IP's.


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/linux_virtual_machine.html.markdown.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachine-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachine.ts#L111">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>maxBidPrice: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for this Virtual Machine, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machine will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that the Virtual Machine should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet" data-link-title="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L21">
        Resource <strong>LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a Linux Virtual Machine Scale Set.

#### Disclaimers

> **Note** This provider will automatically update & reimage the nodes in the Scale Set (if Required) during an Update - this behaviour can be configured using the `features` configuration within the Provider configuration block.

> **Note:** This resource does not support Unmanaged Disks. If you need to use Unmanaged Disks you can continue to use the `azure.compute.ScaleSet` resource instead


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/linux_virtual_machine_scale_set.html.markdown.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>healthProbeId: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The ID of a Load Balancer Probe which should be used to determine the health of an instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. This is Required and can only be specified when `upgradeMode` is set to `Automatic` or `Rolling`.

deployments and may be missing (undefined) during planning phases.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L119">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>maxBidPrice: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machines in the Scale Set will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set should not be evicted for price reasons.

The name of the Linux Virtual Machine Scale Set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet-overprovision">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L135">property <b>overprovision</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>overprovision: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Should Azure over-provision Virtual Machines in this Scale Set? This means that multiple Virtual Machines will be provisioned and Azure will keep the instances which become available first - which improves provisioning success rates and improves deployment time. You're not billed for these over-provisioned VM's and they don't count towards the Subscription Quota. Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet-scaleInPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L160">property <b>scaleInPolicy</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>scaleInPolicy: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The scale-in policy rule that decides which virtual machines are chosen for removal when a Virtual Machine Scale Set is scaled in. Possible values for the scale-in policy rules are `Default`, `NewestVM` and `OldestVM`, defaults to `Default`. For more information about scale in policy, please [refer to this doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-scale-in-policy).

    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ManagedDisk</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a managed disk.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/managed_disk.html.markdown.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDisk-constructor">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDisk-diskIopsReadWrite">

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ScaleSet" data-link-title="ScaleSet">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/scaleSet.ts#L18">
        Resource <strong>ScaleSet</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>ScaleSet</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a virtual machine scale set.

## Disclaimers

> **Note:** The `azure.compute.ScaleSet` resource has been superseded by the `azure.compute.LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet` and `azure.compute.WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet` resources. The existing `azure.compute.ScaleSet` resource will continue to be available throughout the 2.x releases however is in a feature-frozen state to maintain compatibility - new functionality will instead be added to the `azure.compute.LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet` and `azure.compute.WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet` resources.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/virtual_machine_scale_set.html.markdown.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ScaleSet-singlePlacementGroup">

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="VirtualMachine" data-link-title="VirtualMachine">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/virtualMachine.ts#L20">
        Resource <strong>VirtualMachine</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>VirtualMachine</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a Virtual Machine.

#### Disclaimers

> **Note:** The `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource has been superseded by the `azure.compute.LinuxVirtualMachine` and `azure.compute.WindowsVirtualMachine` resources. The existing `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource will continue to be available throughout the 2.x releases however is in a feature-frozen state to maintain compatibility - new functionality will instead be added to the `azure.compute.LinuxVirtualMachine` and `azure.compute.WindowsVirtualMachine` resources.

> **Note:** Data Disks can be attached either directly on the `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource, or using the `azure.compute.DataDiskAttachment` resource - but the two cannot be used together. If both are used against the same Virtual Machine, spurious changes will occur.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/virtual_machine.html.markdown.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="VirtualMachineScaleSetExtension" data-link-title="VirtualMachineScaleSetExtension">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/virtualMachineScaleSetExtension.ts#L17">
        Resource <strong>VirtualMachineScaleSetExtension</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>VirtualMachineScaleSetExtension</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages an Extension for a Virtual Machine Scale Set.

> **NOTE:** This resource is not intended to be used with the `azure.compute.ScaleSet` resource - instead it's intended for this to be used with the `azure.compute.LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSet` and `azure.compute.WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet` resources.


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/virtual_machine_scale_set_extension.html.markdown.

Create a VirtualMachineScaleSetExtension resource with the given unique name, arguments, and options.

* `name` The _unique_ name of the resource.
* `args` The arguments to use to populate this resource&#39;s properties.
* `opts` A bag of options that control this resource&#39;s behavior.

Should the latest version of the Extension be used at Deployment Time, if one is available? This won't auto-update the extension on existing installation. Defaults to `true`.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachine" data-link-title="WindowsVirtualMachine">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L25">
        Resource <strong>WindowsVirtualMachine</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>WindowsVirtualMachine</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a Windows Virtual Machine.

#### Disclaimers

> **Note** This provider will automatically remove the OS Disk by default - this behaviour can be configured using the `features` configuration within the Provider configuration block.

> **Note** This resource does not support Unmanaged Disks. If you need to use Unmanaged Disks you can continue to use the `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource instead.

> **Note** This resource does not support attaching existing OS Disks. You can instead capture an image of the OS Disk or continue to use the `azure.compute.VirtualMachine` resource instead.

> In this release there's a known issue where the `publicIpAddress` and `publicIpAddresses` fields may not be fully populated for Dynamic Public IP's.


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/windows_virtual_machine.html.markdown.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachine-licenseType">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L107">property <b>licenseType</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>licenseType: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies the type of on-premise license (also known as [Azure Hybrid Use Benefit](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-hybrid-use-benefit-licensing)) which should be used for this Virtual Machine. Possible values are `None`, `Windows_Client` and `Windows_Server`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachine-location">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L111">property <b>location</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>location: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The Azure location where the Windows Virtual Machine should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachine-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L115">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>maxBidPrice: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for this Virtual Machine, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machine will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that the Virtual Machine should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet" data-link-title="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L21">
        Resource <strong>WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#CustomResource'>CustomResource</a></code></pre>

Manages a Windows Virtual Machine Scale Set.

#### Disclaimers

> **Note** This provider will automatically update & reimage the nodes in the Scale Set (if Required) during an Update - this behaviour can be configured using the `features` configuration within the Provider configuration block.

> **Note:** This resource does not support Unmanaged Disks. If you need to use Unmanaged Disks you can continue to use the `azure.compute.ScaleSet` resource instead


> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/master/website/docs/r/windows_virtual_machine_scale_set.html.markdown.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L123">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>maxBidPrice: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machines in the Scale Set will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that each Virtual Machine in the Scale Set should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet-overprovision">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L139">property <b>overprovision</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>overprovision: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Should Azure over-provision Virtual Machines in this Scale Set? This means that multiple Virtual Machines will be provisioned and Azure will keep the instances which become available first - which improves provisioning success rates and improves deployment time. You're not billed for these over-provisioned VM's and they don't count towards the Subscription Quota. Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet-scaleInPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L164">property <b>scaleInPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>scaleInPolicy: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>pulumi.Output</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The scale-in policy rule that decides which virtual machines are chosen for removal when a Virtual Machine Scale Set is scaled in. Possible values for the scale-in policy rules are `Default`, `NewestVM` and `OldestVM`, defaults to `Default`. For more information about scale in policy, please [refer to this doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-scale-in-policy).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSet-singlePlacementGroup">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>virtualMachineId: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The ID of the Virtual Machine to which the Data Disk should be attached. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DataDiskAttachmentArgs-writeAcceleratorEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/dataDiskAttachment.ts#L178">property <b>writeAcceleratorEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>writeAcceleratorEnabled?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies if Write Accelerator is enabled on the disk. This can only be enabled on `Premium_LRS` managed disks with no caching and [M-Series VMs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/workloads/sap/how-to-enable-write-accelerator). Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineArgs-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachine.ts#L503">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for this Virtual Machine, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machine will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that the Virtual Machine should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L568">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machines in the Scale Set will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-overprovision">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L584">property <b>overprovision</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>overprovision?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Should Azure over-provision Virtual Machines in this Scale Set? This means that multiple Virtual Machines will be provisioned and Azure will keep the instances which become available first - which improves provisioning success rates and improves deployment time. You're not billed for these over-provisioned VM's and they don't count towards the Subscription Quota. Defaults to `false`.

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L609">property <b>scaleInPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>scaleInPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The scale-in policy rule that decides which virtual machines are chosen for removal when a Virtual Machine Scale Set is scaled in. Possible values for the scale-in policy rules are `Default`, `NewestVM` and `OldestVM`, defaults to `Default`. For more information about scale in policy, please [refer to this doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-scale-in-policy).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetState-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L405">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machines in the Scale Set will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetState-overprovision">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L421">property <b>overprovision</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>overprovision?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Should Azure over-provision Virtual Machines in this Scale Set? This means that multiple Virtual Machines will be provisioned and Azure will keep the instances which become available first - which improves provisioning success rates and improves deployment time. You're not billed for these over-provisioned VM's and they don't count towards the Subscription Quota. Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetState-plan">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L422">property <b>plan</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>plan?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/azure/types/input/#LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetPlan'>LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetPlan</a>&gt;;</code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetState-priority">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>priority?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The Priority of this Virtual Machine Scale Set. Possible values are `Regular` and `Spot`. Defaults to `Regular`. Changing this value forces a new resource.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineScaleSetState-scaleInPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L446">property <b>scaleInPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>scaleInPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The scale-in policy rule that decides which virtual machines are chosen for removal when a Virtual Machine Scale Set is scaled in. Possible values for the scale-in policy rules are `Default`, `NewestVM` and `OldestVM`, defaults to `Default`. For more information about scale in policy, please [refer to this doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-scale-in-policy).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LinuxVirtualMachineState-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/linuxVirtualMachine.ts#L361">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for this Virtual Machine, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machine will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that the Virtual Machine should not be evicted for price reasons.

The name of the Linux Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDiskArgs-diskEncryptionSetId">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDiskArgs-diskIopsReadWrite">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDiskArgs-diskMbpsReadWrite">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDiskArgs-diskSizeGb">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDiskState-diskIopsReadWrite">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDiskState-diskMbpsReadWrite">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ManagedDiskState-diskSizeGb">

Specifies the size of the managed disk to create in gigabytes. If `createOption` is `Copy` or `FromImage`, then the value must be equal to or greater than the source's size. The size can only be increased.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ScaleSetArgs-singlePlacementGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/scaleSet.ts#L454">property <b>singlePlacementGroup</b></a>

Specifies whether the scale set is limited to a single placement group with a maximum size of 100 virtual machines. If set to false, managed disks must be used. Default is true. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. See [documentation](http://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-placement-groups) for more information.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ScaleSetState-automaticOsUpgrade">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ScaleSetState-rollingUpgradePolicy">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>rollingUpgradePolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/azure/types/input/#ScaleSetRollingUpgradePolicy'>ScaleSetRollingUpgradePolicy</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ScaleSetState-singlePlacementGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/scaleSet.ts#L339">property <b>singlePlacementGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>singlePlacementGroup?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies whether the scale set is limited to a single placement group with a maximum size of 100 virtual machines. If set to false, managed disks must be used. Default is true. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. See [documentation](http://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-placement-groups) for more information.

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>deleteDataDisksOnTermination?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Should the Data Disks (either the Managed Disks / VHD Blobs) be deleted when the Virtual Machine is destroyed? Defaults to `false`.

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L532">property <b>licenseType</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>licenseType?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies the type of on-premise license (also known as [Azure Hybrid Use Benefit](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-hybrid-use-benefit-licensing)) which should be used for this Virtual Machine. Possible values are `None`, `Windows_Client` and `Windows_Server`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineArgs-location">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L536">property <b>location</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>location?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The Azure location where the Windows Virtual Machine should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineArgs-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L540">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for this Virtual Machine, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machine will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that the Virtual Machine should not be evicted for price reasons.

The name of the Windows Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>healthProbeId?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The ID of a Load Balancer Probe which should be used to determine the health of an instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. This is Required and can only be specified when `upgradeMode` is set to `Automatic` or `Rolling`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-identity">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-instances">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-licenseType">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L597">property <b>licenseType</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>licenseType?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies the type of on-premise license (also known as [Azure Hybrid Use Benefit](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-windows-hybrid-use-benefit-licensing)) which should be used for this Virtual Machine Scale Set. Possible values are `None`, `Windows_Client` and `Windows_Server`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-location">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L601">property <b>location</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>location?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The Azure location where the Windows Virtual Machine Scale Set should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L605">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machines in the Scale Set will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that each Virtual Machine in the Scale Set should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-name">

The name of the Windows Virtual Machine Scale Set. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-overprovision">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L621">property <b>overprovision</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>overprovision?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Should Azure over-provision Virtual Machines in this Scale Set? This means that multiple Virtual Machines will be provisioned and Azure will keep the instances which become available first - which improves provisioning success rates and improves deployment time. You're not billed for these over-provisioned VM's and they don't count towards the Subscription Quota. Defaults to `false`.

The Priority of this Virtual Machine Scale Set. Possible values are `Regular` and `Spot`. Defaults to `Regular`. Changing this value forces a new resource.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetArgs-scaleInPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L646">property <b>scaleInPolicy</b></a>

The scale-in policy rule that decides which virtual machines are chosen for removal when a Virtual Machine Scale Set is scaled in. Possible values for the scale-in policy rules are `Default`, `NewestVM` and `OldestVM`, defaults to `Default`. For more information about scale in policy, please [refer to this doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-scale-in-policy).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetState-adminPassword">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetState-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L430">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for each Virtual Machine in this Scale Set, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machines in the Scale Set will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that each Virtual Machine in the Scale Set should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineScaleSetState-overprovision">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachineScaleSet.ts#L446">property <b>overprovision</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>overprovision?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Should Azure over-provision Virtual Machines in this Scale Set? This means that multiple Virtual Machines will be provisioned and Azure will keep the instances which become available first - which improves provisioning success rates and improves deployment time. You're not billed for these over-provisioned VM's and they don't count towards the Subscription Quota. Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineState-licenseType">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineState-maxBidPrice">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/compute/windowsVirtualMachine.ts#L386">property <b>maxBidPrice</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxBidPrice?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum price you're willing to pay for this Virtual Machine, in US Dollars; which must be greater than the current spot price. If this bid price falls below the current spot price the Virtual Machine will be evicted using the `evictionPolicy`. Defaults to `-1`, which means that the Virtual Machine should not be evicted for price reasons.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="WindowsVirtualMachineState-proximityPlacementGroupId">

</h4>
